title: CURRENT-CARRYING CAPACITY OF SUPPLY CONDUCTORS
fullText:
Where a capacitor is controlled by a circuit-breaker as required by Clause 4.15.3.3(a), the conductors connected to the capacitor shall have a current-carrying capacity not less than the greater of—
(a)	135% of the rated current of the capacitor; or
(b)	the setting of the circuit-breaker.
Where a capacitor is permanently connected to a motor circuit, the conductors shall have a current rating of not less than the greater of—
(i)	one-third of the rating of the motor-circuit conductors; or
(ii)	135% of the rated current of the capacitor.
